tagDescription: RIDOUT, Thomas Description of the South East acre of the Hospital Reservation of six acres in the town of York, county of York, granted to the Chief Justice Powell, James Baby and Reverend John Strachan and to their heirs, signed by Thomas Ridout, surveyor.

O'SULLIVAN, Michael Letter from John Dundap and George Buchannon asking some advice concerning problems they met with Constant Cartier after their settlement on lands in the Township of Sherrington, Seigniory of La Salle.

DELISLE, Alexandre-Maurice. Fonctionnaire et homme d'affaires. Lettre de Louis-Hipolyte LaFontaine demandant à A.-M. Delisle, greffier de la Couronne, de lui faire parvenir la liste des personnes accusées de haute trahison ou de participation aux troubles politiques de 1837-1838.

GUGY, Bartholomew Conrad Augustus Letter of thanks from students at Law of Quebec City relating to the defence made by Gugy on behalf of Murdock Morrison, student at Law, against Thomas Cushing Aylwin, 28 October 1836.
DELISLE, Alexandre-Maurice Letter from A. Buchanan relating to Maillet accused of the murder of Lieutenant [George] Weir, 17 November [1838].
PARKER, Rev. J. Parker's journal as an itinerant priest in the Eastern Townships (Quebec), from 25 July 1830 to 21 February 1836.
NATURAL HISTORY SOCIETY OF MONTREAL, Montreal (Quebec) Letter from James O'Donnell relating to a donation of various plans to the Natural History Society of Montreal, 4 December 1829.
ARMOUR, Robert Affidavit signed by Robert Armour relating to the desertion of Ferdinand d'Auberville from his service as apprentice to the art of printing, 8 September 1828.

RAYMOND, Js.-B. Arpenteur. Plan et procès-verbaux d'arpentage et du tracé de la ligne entre les terres de Dominique Chartier et de Jean Archambault situées dans la Côte-Saint-Léonard, signés par Js.-B. Raymond, arpenteur.
MORTON, -. Bookseller in Boston, Unsigned letter from Lady Franklin thanking Morton for the contribution to her expedition in search of her husband Sir John Franklin, 6 July 1859.
CAYA, Thérèse Liquidation des biens que Thérèse Caya doit rendre à Joseph (Le) Vallois, tuteur des enfants mineurs issus de son premier mariage avec Antoine-Régis Levalois, 8 février 1773.
DOMINIQUE AND CUSSON. Specifications of timber measured and counted in a yard and at the canal, signed by Dominique and Cusson, 1st October 1855.

BONSECOURS MARKET, Precept to summon twelve principal householders to appear before justices of the peace at a Court of Special Sessions of the Peace to certify their opinion concerning the laying out of a lot of ground situated between Notre-Dame and St. Paul Streets in a public market; list of the names of these householders, 9 December 1803.
KLONDIKE GOLD RUSH Broadside announcing a forthcoming illustrated lecture relating to the Klondike gold rush of 1897 to 1899, 62 cm x 46 cm.

Map of the British Province of New Brunswick, from the best existing materials; By Authority of the Provincial Legislature: with adjacent parts of Canada, Nova-Scotia & Maine. Compiled and drawn by John Wilkinson, surveyor and civil engineer, associate of the institution of civil engineers. A.D. 1859.
PAPINEAU, Joseph Déclarations de Joseph Papineau et d'Antoine Foucher concernant leur choix de demeurer notaires et de Pierre Mézière, celui de demeurer avocat, 5 mai 1786.
FRANKLIN, Sir John Letter from Franklin to Mr. Murray, his publisher, concerning alterations to his book on his expedition across North America.

HAYES, Dr. Isaac Israel. American physician and Arctic explorer. Book entitled: The Open Polar Sea. A narrative of a voyage of discovery towards the North Pole, in the Schooner United States , by I.I. Hayes, New York, Hurd and Houghton, 1867, 454 pages.

GREAT BRITAIN, Laws, statutes, 18th century Anno Regni Georgii III. Regis Magnae Britanniae, Franciae, & Hiberniae, Decimo Sexto. At the Parliament begun and holden at Westminster, the Twenty-ninth Day of November, Anno Domini 1774, in the Fifteenth Year of the Reign of our Sovereign Lord George the Third, by the Grace of God, of Great Britain, France, and Ireland, King, Defender of the Faith, Etc., London, Charles Eyre and William Strahan, 1776, 4 pages.

HENDERSON, Andrew . Writer and bookseller. Publication entitled: Considerations on the Question Whether the Act of Parliament establishing a Militia thro' England ought to extend to Scotland in Time of War?, by Andrew Henderson, [London], Printed for A. Johnson, Westminster-Hall, 1761, 47 pages.

THIBAULT, Louis. Ordre du grand-voyer Jean-Baptiste d'Estimauville enjoignant Louis Thibault, inspecteur des chemins de Saint-Jean-Port-Joli, de se conformer aux directives de la loi pour la construction ou réfection de ses chemins, 21 mai 1810. Copie imprimée des directives du Bureau du grand-voyer à Québec pour les inspecteurs et les sous-voyers des chemins et ponts des paroisses du district de Québec, 24 avril 1810.

STEVENSON, David Barker . Letters from Benjamin Seymour: one describes in detail the attack on Lord Elgin by the mob opposed to the Rebellion Losses Bill in Montreal, 1st May 1849; the other discusses various motions to remove the seat of Parliament from Montreal to Kingston, Quebec or Toronto, 12 May 1849.

DELISLE, Alexandre-Maurice . Public servant and businessman. Letter from Alexandre Comeau requesting on behalf of Messrs. Beaubien, Tait, Holmes and Lemoine, a meeting of the magistrates relating to complaints made by some of the Lachine labourers, 22 March 1843.
LEMAÎTRE BELNOIS, Désiré Nomination de Désiré Lemaître Belnois comme huissier à la Cour du banc du roi du district de Trois-Rivières, 8 février 1840.

MONTREAL (Québec), Rues Documents et plans relatifs à l'ouverture de rues à la Pointe-à- Callières et près des fortifications: rapports de l'inspecteur des chemins, Paul Lacroix; déclarations et recommandations de jurés nommés à la suite d'une requête de Pierre Foretier; opposition d'Antoine Papineau au passage de deux rues sur son terrain.

AYLMER, Matthew Whitworth, 5e baron Requête de Charles Gauthier, détenu à la prison de Montréal, demandant à Lord Aylmer de le gracier de la peine du fouet sur la place publique pour avoir volé une somme d'argent, 12 mars 1832.
DELISLE, [Alexandre-Maurice] Memorandum to [A.-M.] Delisle from J.J. Mathews relating to the Félix Poutré insurance claim, 24 March 1841.
BOUCHETTE, Joseph Lettre de [Michel-Eustache-Gaspard-Alain] Chartier de Lotbinière relative à quelques irrégularités concernant la frontière entre les Haut et Bas-Canada, 28 décembre 1819.

LOWER CANADA, Office of the Peace, District of Montreal Deposition of Eve Vanderboget, wife of William Lawley, and recognizance to give evidence against Thomas Clotworthy, accused of buggery, 19 August 1839.

MONTREAL (Québec), Conseil de ville Copie conforme des dépositions, devant la Cour du banc du roi du district de Montréal, de Ludger Duvernay et d'Andrew H. Armour, respectivement propriétaires de La Minerve et du Montreal Gazette, certifiant la publication en français et en anglais d'un avis sur les règlements et ordonnances du conseil de ville de Montréal, 31 juillet 1833.
LOWER CANADA, Return of the baptisms, marriages and burials for the District of Montreal for the year 1827.
PERRAULT, Joseph-François Réponse de J.-F. Perrault adressée à Jean-Baptiste Durocher et Alexandre Serres relative à l'exception alléguée par ledit A. Serres, 22 septembre 1792.

HURTEAU, Hilaire . Notaire, député et surintendant général de la colonisation. Lettre d'Ernest Gagnon, secrétaire du départment de l'Agriculture et des Travaux publics, informant H. Hurteau de sa nomination comme surintendant général des travaux de colonisation dans la province de Québec, 15 décembre 1882; projet de rapport d'Hurteau sur la colonisation, [s.d.].

BAS-CANADA, Cour des plaidoyers communs, district de Québec Ordonnance de Thomas Dunn, un des juges de la Cour des plaidoyers communs du district de Québec, enjoignant Jean-Baptiste Morin, lieutenant de milice de la paroisse de Saint-Roch, de faire la saisie et la vente des biens de Pierre-Noël Gagné et de sa femme afin de payer François Verreau, 2 septembre 1791. Au verso, procès-verbal de la saisie et vente des biens signés par Jean-Baptiste Morin, 4 octobre 1791.

LOWER CANADA, Superior Court, Account of the estate of the late David David produced by Moses Judah Hays, one of the defendants, and sole surviving acting executor and trustee of the same, for a cause against Moses E. David, plaintiff and one of the nine residuary legatees of David David.

UNITED STATES - BOUNDARIES - GREAT BRITAIN Printed document relating to the boundary between the United States and Great Britain, including reports of the American and British Commissioners, 1827. Bound volume of 19 fold maps, 1838 (25th Congress, 2nd Session, House Ext. Doc. 451).

HAGAR, Charles Revocatory action by Charles Hagar, a creditor of the late Benjamin Brewster, relating to a deed of sale from him to the defendant Mr. Smith, of a property between the Lachine Road and the Canal on 3 September 1861.

MORISON, Murdoch. Montreal Advocate. Letter from Ogilvy Moffatt, secretary of the Provincial Grand Lodge, district of Montreal Wm. Henry, calling a meeting of the members of the Provincial Grand Lodge, 15 Febr. 1855.
